intro: Odontites linkii subsp. linkii, commonly known as the Alpine toothbrush, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, basal leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy slopes at high elevations. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments. Its name refers to the tooth-like shape of its leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs.
